channel.title: Physics Post
channel.description: Read physics and science articles. Learn about black holes, speed of light and superstring theory.
channel.dc:creator: Physics Post (mailto:ghb@uwm.edu)

item.title: Does spooky action at a distance allow faster than light communication
item.description: Quantum entanglement as first explained in the EPR paper written by Einstein and his colleagues seems to imply that a quotspookyquot connection exists between particles that have interacted in the past Does this connection allow us to communicate faster than the speed of light
item.dc:creator: David Mcmahon (mailto:dmmcmah@sandia.gov)

item.title: The Method of Eigenfunction Expansion
item.description: In this article we explore a technique used to solve partial differential equations called the method of eigenfunction expansion
item.dc:creator: David Mcmahon (mailto:dmmcmah@sandia.gov)

item.title: 7 Keys to Success with a Physics Degree
item.description: Students and educators in physics often worry that a physics degree leaves students unprepared for jobs in industry In this article we explore seven steps students can take to ensure that while getting their physics degree they are also preparing themselves for a job in industry
item.dc:creator: David Mcmahon (mailto:dmmcmah@sandia.gov)

item.title: Employment in Physics
item.description: There have been frequent questions on the kinds of employment that are available for physicists That question is very difficult to answer because it depends on a number of factors such as where you are what degree you obtained what area of specialization you went into and what skill you have acquired
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Condensed Matter Physics
item.description: Consider the fact that when most brighteyed physics majors in their first year entering a university they are either not aware or hardly know anything about a field of physics known as condensed matter
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Why is Quantum Mechanics SO difficult
item.description: Strangely enough QM39s formalism isn39t any more difficult than other areas of physics The mathematics of the quotstandardquot QM isn39t any worse than let39s say electromagnetism Yet to many people especially nonphysicists QM presents a very daunting effort to understand
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: So You Want To Be A Physicist 3
item.description: We are still discussing the final year of your undergraduate education So far we have covered what you need to consider if you want to go on to graduate school and prepare yourself as best as you can for that part of your journey However this isn39t the only path one can take with an undergraduate physics degree Many physics degree holder do not continue to pursue a graduate degree in physics
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: So You Want To Be A Physicist 2
item.description: We have now reached the final year of your undergraduate program By now you would have gone through courses in the fundamental pillars of physics Classical mechanics Quantum mechanics and EM and even courses in ThermodynamicsStatistical Physics
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: So You Want To Be A Physicist
item.description: One of the most frequent questions we get besides the annoying quotcan anything travel faster than cquot or quotshouldn39t light have mass since Emc2quot is the process and background of being a physics major Often we have students asking what are the requirements of obtaining a physics degree and what can one do with such accomplishments
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Steady state theory
item.description: In cosmology the steady state theory is a model developed in 1949 by Fred Hoyle Thomas Gold and others as an alternative to the Big Bang theory Although the model had a large number of supporters among cosmologists in the 1950s and 1960s the number of supporters decreased markedly in the late 1960s and today it is considered a nonstandard cosmology It is also the basis for another theory known as the quasisteady state theory which postulates a lot of little big bangs occurring over time
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Vacuum energy
item.description: Quantum field theory considers the vacuum ground state not to be completely empty but to consist of a seething mass of virtual particles and fields
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: National Security Nightmare
item.description: World scientists have been committing millions and now billions of dollars in 2004 for the research and construction of a quantum computer capable of performing calculations a billion times faster than a classical computer
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Car handling physics model in Xpand Rally
item.description: During the design and the creation of Xpand Rally its developers were aiming towards completely new quality and realism level in a racing game
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Nikola Tesla
item.description: Nikola Tesla July 10 1856 January 7 1943 Baptism name Nikolaj Name in Cyrillic alphabet was a SerbAmerican physicist mathematician inventor and electrical engineer
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: The Future of Biotechnology
item.description: This lecture is based on interviews with 150 of the worlds top scientists many of them Nobel Laureates or directors of major scientific laboratories about their conception of the science of the next 20 to 50 years
item.dc:creator: Michio Kaku (mailto:Mkaku@Mkaku.org)

item.title: Piercing the Haze of Titan
item.description: Imagine an alien world where hydrocarbons reign or rain instead of water More than mere speculation such a place is believed to exist in our solar system This world has been named Titan as it is by far the largest of Saturns 31 moons Titan has been a long time curiosity to astronomers and now finally we are set to conduct some significant upclose explorations
item.dc:creator: James Ropp (mailto:phobos042@yahoo.com)

item.title: NavierStokes equations
item.description: In fluid dynamics the NavierStokes equations are a set of nonlinear partial differential equations that describe the flow of fluids such as liquids and gases
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Bacterial Mechanisms of Infection An Introduction
item.description: Bacteria are our friend and foes and some have developed specific mechanism to colonize animals Commensal bacteria use these mechanism to benefits their host whereas infectious bacteria use the same mechanism as biological weapons In this article I will introduce the fine line that differentiate between friends and enemies
item.dc:creator: Yannick Tremblay (mailto:yantremblay29@hotmail.com)

item.title: Mesothelioma
item.description: Mesothelioma is an uncommon form of cancer associated with prolonged exposure to asbestos which affects the pleura a sac which surrounds the lungs the peritoneum the lining of the abdominal cavity or the pericardium a sac which surrounds the heart
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: A Trip as Far Away as SpaceTime Will Allow
item.description: No one knows if aliens are really blowing up their starships over Council Bluffs But if extraterrestrial life forms are visiting from time to time somewhere some sentient beings must have figured out a way to transit interstellar space
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Neural networks
item.description: An artificial neural network more commonly known as a neural network or neural net for short is a mathematical model for information processing based on a connectionist approach to computation
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Fermionic condensate
item.description: The fermionic condensate is a new phase of matter first created on December 16 2003 by physicist Deborah S Jin It is the sixth known phase of matter and is related to the BoseEinstein condensate which was first created in 1995 The five other phases of matter are gases solids liquids plasmas and BoseEinstein condensates
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: My Name Finally Makes an Impact
item.description: On July 4 2005 my name will be obliterated NASA is burning my name onto a CD and blasting it off the face of the Earth set on a collision course with a nearby comet Deep Impact mission
item.dc:creator: James Ropp (mailto:phobos042@yahoo.com)

item.title: Protonproton chains
item.description: The protonproton chain reaction also known as the PP chain is one of two fusion reactions by which stars convert hydrogen to helium the other being the CNO cycle The protonproton chain is more important in stars the size of the Sun or less
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Digital circuits
item.description: Digital circuits are electric circuits based on a number of discrete voltage levels In most cases there are two voltage levels one near to zero volts and one at a higher level depending on the supply voltage in use
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Ren Descartes
item.description: We may consider Descartes as the first of the modern school of mathematics Ren Descartes was born near Tours on March 31 1596 and died at Stockholm on February 11 1650 thus he was a contemporary of Galileo and Desargues
item.dc:creator: Tab Stevens (mailto:tab21@earthlink.net)

item.title: Your Environment Can Affect Your Health
item.description: There are many factors that can cause your physiology to move away from that state of balance in which you enjoy perfect complete health One big factor is environment Climatetemperatures outside
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer (mailto:na@notavailible.com)

item.title: Questioning the Proof
item.description: Science has the problem of induction we can not really know anything to be ultimately true thus a perfect 39proof39 in the mathematical sense is unattainable Proof is however in mathematics the essence But what are the simliarities between the types of proof Read on
item.dc:creator: Christian Ottem (mailto:christian_ottem@yahoo.no)

item.title: Forces
item.description: These are the topic areas that will be discussed Basics of Forces Force Diagrams Addition of Forces EquilibriumGravity and Friction
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Particle Systems A Physically Based Modelling Approach
item.description: This article will pick up where the last article finished It will show the reader how to make more accurate simulations using numerical methods
item.dc:creator: Paul Hancock (mailto:mr___diablo@hotmail.com)

item.title: Well miss you Galileo
item.description: Read about the blazing end to an unprecedented survey of the solar systems largest planet by NASAs Galileo spacecraft that resulted in amazing discoveries whiteknuckle moments and some interesting sidebars
item.dc:creator: James Ropp (mailto:phobos042@yahoo.com)

item.title: Energy Redshift Paradox
item.description: Within the framework of General Relativity in one of its most simple forms the Schwarzschild solution a very interesting paradox can be proposed involving the conservation of work energy Its a puzzle for the Relativity buff In this short discussion I outline this energy redshift paradox and the implications for an attempted solution
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: Mechanical Energy Basics
item.description: These are the topic areas covered in the notes for this article The Concept of Energy Work and Power Potential Energy Kinetic Energy Change in Energy Conservation of Energy Elastic Collisions
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: An Introduction to Black Hole Thermodynamics
item.description: Black Holes have always ben a controversial affair among Theoretical Astrophysicists Especially the Thermodynamics of a Black Hole It was considered that the entropy of a Black Hole is infinitely large until Stephen Hawking proved that Black Holes are not really Black They infact Radiate and evaporate How is this so What are the laws of Thermodynamics governing this process Read on
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Narayanan (mailto:sridhar_n@email.com)

item.title: Impact of the natural universal phylogenetic classification on the evolution of cells theory
item.description: Taxonomy is often seen as a trivial and boring part of biology For many decades classification of organisms was based on morphology behaviour and distribution in the environment With the advance of molecular biology and the sequencing era a modern classification tool arose the smallsubunit of ribosomal ribonucleic acid A new universal phylogenetic tree was born Recently a new theory about cellular emerged The theory was influence by the 1618S rRNAbased phylogenetic tree
item.dc:creator: Yannick Tremblay (mailto:yantremblay29@hotmail.com)

item.title: Introduction to Cryptology Part 1
item.description: This series of articles will introduce readers to the ancient art and science of cryptology No high tech wizardry here it39s all simple and dare I say fun
item.dc:creator: Paul Hancock (mailto:mr___diablo@hotmail.com)

item.title: Understanding Quantum Tunneling
item.description: RichardPFeynman once said quotI think it would be safe for me to say that no one in this world understands Quantum Mechanicsquot Such an amazing theory Quantum Mechanics is yet hard to understand Quantum Tunneling has always been given in small portions of many text books and details have not been covered so as to aid better understanding of the ConceptIn this article I have made an attempt to provide a better understanding of Tunneling Go along read it
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Narayanan (mailto:sridhar_n@email.com)

item.title: Are Humans Still Evolving
item.description: It may seem like civilisation has removed all of the selective pressures faced by wild animals but Natural Selection acts on a lot more than superficial characteristics Natural Selection is an omnipresent force shaping everything even the things that we think we are choosing
item.dc:creator: Shane Greenup (mailto:mgreenup@bigpond.net.au)

item.title: Two males getting their own genetic baby a future possibility
item.description: Recently a fertilization technique concieved human embryos with three genetic parents Would a baby with samesex parents be possible
item.dc:creator: Monique van der Voet (mailto:niqqie@hotmail.com)

item.title: Geometry in Space
item.description: Geometry is how Nature displays itself to us Geometry is the language of Nature We have only been exposed to Geometry inside Earth How beautiful is the Geometry of Outer Space
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Narayanan (mailto:sridhar_n@email.com)

item.title: Matrix AlgebraThis one39s new
item.description: This is a fundamental discovery on the existence of circulants Circulants are Matrices which have a sequence of arrangements of the elements The article deals with a new Algebra developed on Matrices
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Narayanan (mailto:sridhar_n@email.com)

item.title: QuantumChromodynamics A Definition
item.description: QCD describes the interactions between quarks in high energy physics Here I will give you a few bits of information to spark your interest
item.dc:creator: Tab Stevens (mailto:tab21@earthlink.net)

item.title: Wave Interference Basics
item.description: The topics discussed in the article include Standing waves Superposition Resonance Lasers Resonance in strings Resonance in air columns Diffraction Interference patterns Diffraction Gratings Spectral analysis
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Why do we age
item.description: Aging is a result of evolution not something selected by evolution but something outside the selective powers of evolution As research uncovers more and more about the mechanisms behind aging the exact nature of this fact is being realised more and more
item.dc:creator: Shane Greenup (mailto:mgreenup@bigpond.net.au)

item.title: Electrostatic Basics
item.description: These are the topic areas covered in this article Nature of Charge Charging Process Electrical Force Electrical Fields Electrical Potential Energy Electrical Potential
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: The Consequences of Physical Immortality
item.description: Bruce J Klein founder of the Immortality Institute ImmInstorg answers questions by 39Kharin39 from the Virus Forums Topics covered overpopulation resource scarcity economic consequences accelerating change and the Singularity
item.dc:creator: Bruce J. Klein (mailto:bjk@bjklein.com)

item.title: Particle Systems
item.description: A practical introduction to a popular computer simulation technique used in such movies as quotShrekquot and quotMonsters Incquot
item.dc:creator: Paul Hancock (mailto:mr___diablo@hotmail.com)

item.title: Feenburgs Twin Paradox Still Unsolved
item.description: Think you know Relativity Beaten the paradox of the twins to death scourged every possible edifice Only those too lazy to study still believe there to be a paradox yet today You might be surprised just how many Relativity experts dont really understand the key to this particular incarnation of the paradox Is there a problem with rotation symmetry in the velocity transformation
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: Men and women like chalk and cheese Sex differences in brain and behaviour
item.description: Men and women completely different They think differently act differently reason differently its a wonder any relationship between them ever lasts They might as well come from different planets So the current pop psychological theories suggest But is there any biological evidence for all of this
item.dc:creator: Lucy Maddox (mailto:lucymaddox@hotmail.com)

item.title: The Drake Equation Is there really other Life in the Universe
item.description: Is there other life in the universe We may never know Is there a possibility
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Barlow (mailto:rightascention@yahoo.com)

item.title: Current Electricity Basics
item.description: Circuit Basics Electrical Current Electrical Resistance Electrical Power Electrical Circuits Series Circuits Parallel Circuits Complex Circuits
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Question Answer Chat Event With Dr Michio Kaku
item.description: mkakuorg recently help a chat with Dr Michio Kaku Topics include string theory time travel and the spacetime construct Come inside and find out more
item.dc:creator: Greg Bernhardt (mailto:ghb@uwm.edu)

item.title: Electromagnetism Basics
item.description: Magnets Magnetic polarity Magnetic fields Electromagnetism Electromagnetic fields Magnetic effects on charged particles Magnetic effects on current carrying conductors Applications of electromagnetic concepts Induced current Applications of induction Generators Characteristics of alternating current Motors
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: The Changing nature of Search Engines
item.description: This article briefly discusses search engines and different alternatives to search documents and images on the web
item.dc:creator: Srimannarayana Grandhi (mailto:grandhis@cqufic.ac.fj)

item.title: Uniform Motion Basics
item.description: ScalarsVectors Uniform Motion PositionDistanceDisplacement SpeedVelocity AverageInstantaneous Motion Graphs will all be discussed in the exploration of beginning physics
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: In the Belly of an Angry Giant Speculations on Residing in a Very Large Black Hole
item.description: Apparent doom a reasonable thought or the work of crackpottery You be the judge
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: Optic Basics Part 22
item.description: This is the second installment of the Optic Basics series You39ll learn about Using mirror equations Refraction Snells Law and Lenses
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Why Bandwidth is important
item.description: Bandwidth can be the difference between the lowest and highest frequencies The available frequency is divided into several channels using Frequency Division Multiplexing Technique FDM
item.dc:creator: Srimannarayana Grandhi (mailto:grandhis@cqufic.ac.fj)

item.title: Optic Basics Part 12
item.description: When any wave encounters an object it can do one of three things it can bounce off the object reflection it can go into the object refraction or it can go past the object diffraction In each case changes in the lights path occurs
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Misc Science Tips
item.description: Short descriptions of Lightning Dry Cell Batteries Threeway Switches the Van Allen Belts and Guitar Pickups
item.dc:creator: John Bruning (mailto:portajohn04@hotmail.com)

item.title: Hyperspace and a Theory of Everything
item.description: When I was a child I used to visit the Japanese Tea Garden in San Francisco I would spend hours fascinated by the carp who lived in a very shallow pond just inches beneath the lily pads
item.dc:creator: Michio Kaku (mailto:Mkaku@Mkaku.org)

item.title: Momentum Basics
item.description: These are the topic areas covered in this article Impulse Momentum Change in Momentum and Conservation of Momentum
item.dc:creator: Tom Young (mailto:tyoung@waukesha.k12.wi.us)

item.title: Introduction to Black Holes
item.description: As far back as the beginning man people have looked to the heavens and wondered what is actually up there Many have hypothesized studied and used various sorts of equipment to research the heavens
item.dc:creator: Tab Stevens (mailto:tab21@earthlink.net)

item.title: Recent Chat with Michio Kaku
item.description: A chat recently held by mkakuorg has brought up some interesting information Dr Kaku answers some of his fan39s questions about the universe
item.dc:creator: Greg Bernhardt (mailto:ghb@uwm.edu)

item.title: Neural Integration and Electro Potentials
item.description: Just some information I picked up from that neurology mail correspondance course
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: Planetary Formation Based on Matter Condensation and Accretion
item.description: The millions of years of stellar evolution summed up in about two pages
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: Space Elevators The Time for Laughing is Over
item.description: With the discovery and subsequent development of carbon nanotubes the possibility finally exists to replace current chemical based launch systems with space elevators This article takes a look at risk cost and market analyses comparing current launch systems proposed second generation launch systems and space elevators
item.dc:creator: David K. Pullen (mailto:enigma555@mailcity.com)

item.title: HyperSpace A Scientific Odyssey
item.description: Do higher dimensions exist Are there unseen worlds just beyond our reach beyond the normal laws of physics Although higher dimensions have historically been the exclusive realm of charlatans mystics and science fiction writers
item.dc:creator: Michio Kaku (mailto:Mkaku@Mkaku.org)

item.title: An Introduction to Kramer39s Rule
item.description: I always thought this was handy in those inevitable cases where I would have to solve n unknowns in n equations
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: What to Do If You Have a Proposal for the Unified Field Theory
item.description: I would like to give some guidelines for people who have thoughtfully pondered the question of the meaning of spacetime
item.dc:creator: Michio Kaku (mailto:Mkaku@Mkaku.org)

item.title: Book Review The Problem of the Soul Two Visions of Mind and How to Reconcile
item.description: After a lifetime spent reading the obfuscating works of philosophers and theologians twisting logic into pretzelian contortions to prove such unprovable concepts as God the soul and free will
item.dc:creator: Michael Shermer (mailto:skepticmag@aol.com)

item.title: Managing Biological Pollution from Transgenic Crops
item.description: Transgenic crops crops whose genes have been modified to be resistant to pests and disease are a permanent part of worldwide agriculture
item.dc:creator: Jon Johnson (mailto:joe11@hotmail.com)

item.title: At Heart I am Irrational and Demonstrate this with Elegant Absurdity
item.description:
Archimedes irrationality absurdity and the usual smutty insinuation Come drink from my cyber mouth
No lengthy introduction today I have embedded my rambling for your pleasure
item.dc:creator: Kelvin Corlett (mailto:Malevolent_pixie@hotmail.com)

item.title: Quantum Computers Towards the Future
item.description: Quantum computers represent the future of computing and will very likely overtake classical computers within this century Their size and speed will revolutionize every aspect of technology in the same way classical computers have
item.dc:creator: Jon Johnson (mailto:joe11@hotmail.com)

item.title: Shuttle Thermal Tiles Description and Suggestions
item.description: Friction with the air is often neglected but when traveling at Mach 18 it becomes a huge factor To cope with this NASA engineers have ingeniously developed sandbased thermal tiles that are designed to withstand temperatures that can reach up to 2600 degrees Fahrenheit
item.dc:creator: Jon Johnson (mailto:joe11@hotmail.com)

item.title: Proof by Induction the Power Rule and a Moderate Snipe at Engineers
item.description:
Hey you You want to be certain about the truth of mathematical statements You better had or I39m going to be mightily angry Here39s a brief example of how you can be in certain cases
Note Go straight to page 2 if you want the good stuff
item.dc:creator: Kelvin Corlett (mailto:Malevolent_pixie@hotmail.com)

item.title: Good Screen Names
item.description: This essay will discuss briefly just how many screen names there are and then go in depth about just how hard it would really be to crack a screen name with a completely random password without an exploit
item.dc:creator: Jon Johnson (mailto:joe11@hotmail.com)

item.title: Book Review Mathematical Techniques an Introduction
item.description:
Hey you want an introduction to Mathematical Techniques You39re in luck my friend it just so happens that I can fix you up
Just make sure you use protection
Note You may not want to read this if you happen to hate the rambling selfindulgent style adopted by Dj Sneaky Whiskers in his Physicsforum book reviews My similarity to him is almost sinister
item.dc:creator: Kelvin Corlett (mailto:Malevolent_pixie@hotmail.com)

item.title: Doubly Special Relativity in Brief
item.description: An amazing basic beginner39s guide to DSR and how it differs from conventional relativity
item.dc:creator: FZ (mailto:FZpost@fangs.freeserve.co.uk)

item.title: Maxwell39s Equations
item.description: This article looks at the concepts of electricity and magnetism and maxwell39s role in uniting them
item.dc:creator: Nicole Kennedy (mailto:Nicolek_271@yahoo.co.uk)

item.title: The Theory and Instrumentation of the Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometer
item.description: Atomic absorption spectroscopy AAS is the appropriate term used when electromagnetic radiation EMR is absorbed or emitted by atoms and measured
item.dc:creator: Ana Gamboa (mailto:Entropia@physicsforums.com)

item.title: How to Control Runaway Nanotechnology
item.description: On Apr 20 2003 around fifteen Immortality Institute members and guest participated in an online chat to discuss how best to control the potentially dangerous prospect of runaway nanotechnology
item.dc:creator: Bruce J. Klein (mailto:bjk@bjklein.com)

item.title: Unified Relativity
item.description: Have you ever wondered why General Relativity breaks down at extremely small scales Have you ever thought that maybe there is some simple connection with Quantum Mechanics that were missing What I propose in this paper is my personal view on this missing link between the two powerful theories
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: Biological Invasion a Killer alga
item.description: The ecological damage that can be done when a foreign agent is introduced into a new niche should not be underestimated A recent example is that of severe acute respiratory syndrome SARS where a virus normally infecting life stock found a new host in humans Amazing is the example of an alga that has started to take over the coastal regions all over the world This is a tale of Caulerpa taxifolia
item.dc:creator: Monique van der Voet (mailto:niqqie@hotmail.com)

item.title: Book Review Linux for Windows Addicts
item.description: Everyone has a stance in the OS debates but I39ve really never taken a side I have Mandrake on one machine and I could do some commands and simple stuff but I didn39t really know what Linux was all about
item.dc:creator: Greg Bernhardt (mailto:ghb@uwm.edu)

item.title: Book Review The Complete Idiot39s Guide to Calculus
item.description: I39ve never really been very good at math and when I found out I had to take a Calculus class I started to panic Once I gathered myself I went to the local bookstore to see if I could get a book to read
item.dc:creator: Greg Bernhardt (mailto:ghb@uwm.edu)

item.title: Linear Independence and Wronskian Determinants
item.description: Linear Algebra and Calculus distinct from one another Read on and find out
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: An Introduction to Linear Algebra
item.description: A brief introduction to linear algebra This tutorial can be thought of as a precursor to the article quotAn Introduction to Eigenvalues and Eigenvectorsquot
item.dc:creator: Paul Hancock (mailto:mr___diablo@hotmail.com)

item.title: Entirely Rotational Internal Combustion Hydrogen Engine
item.description: With the everlooming threat imposed by dwindling fossils fuel supplies we constantly need to develop and improve the efficiency of our engines One of the safest alternate fuel sources to crude oil is hydrogen Our current engine designs however are very wasteful in the method of converting fuel into motion Using hydrogen as a fuel makes those inefficiencies even more pronounced Here is a design that attacks some of those inefficiencies the ERICH engine
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: Complex Numbers The Other Side of Algebra
item.description: We all have worked with the real number system for as long as we can remember The set of imaginary numbers are a mystery that many of us have never explored You can39t take the square root of 81 Or can you
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Barlow (mailto:rightascention@yahoo.com)

item.title: Stellar Energy Generation and Nucleosynthesis
item.description: This article is a brief explanation of energy generation in stars and the means of creating heavier elements
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: The NewtonRaphson Method for the Approximation of Polynomial and Monomial Roots
item.description: There are other Calculusbased methods for finding the roots of a function Find out more in this article
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: Differentiation of the natural exponential function e
item.description: This is a follow up to Carter Bowles quotDerivatives An Introduction to Calculusquot This article explains the derivation of the natural exponential function which has many applications in exponential growth and decay
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Pucci (mailto:illy2k@optonline.net)

item.title: Tapping the Vacuum Energy with Nanotechnology
item.description: Is the dream of tapping into the vacuum energy by exploiting the uncertainty principle a hoax There seems to be very little doubt that an ambient energy level exists in the vacuum devoid of matter even if this energy is due strictly to the uncertainty demanded by quantum mechanics but can such energy be tapped to produce power Knowing thermodynamics I had never thought twice about the impracticality of the idea until I thought of a very simple idea using nanotechnology
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: The Physics of ExtraTerrestrial Civilizations
item.description: The late Carl Sagan once asked this question quotWhat does it mean for a civilization to be a million years old We have had radio telescopes and spaceships for a few decades our technical civilization is a few hundred years old an advanced civilization millions of years old is as much beyond us as we are beyond a bush baby or a macaquequot
item.dc:creator: Michio Kaku (mailto:Mkaku@Mkaku.org)

item.title: Conceptual Quantum Mechanics
item.description: The title of this article is somewhat misleading as nobody truly conceives quantum mechanics It is called conceptual only because no math is involved Interested in the theory but still unable to understand what is going This could help
item.dc:creator: Carter Bowles (mailto:CJames745@yahoo.com)

item.title: The Last Man On The Moon
item.description: On 11th December 1972 just over 30 years ago man set foot on the moon for the last time The Apollo 17 mission manned by Eugene Cernan and geologist Harrison Schmitt was the last in the program marking the end of quite possibly the most important era in space exploration
item.dc:creator: Nicole Kennedy (mailto:Nicolek_271@yahoo.co.uk)

item.title: Look At It This Way By Steve Mason
item.description: There39s a line from that classic tune quotOld Man Riverquot that goes tired a39livin but scared a39dyin Interestingly enough that probably sums up the feelings of a significant share of the population As the average age goes up an evergreater number of people are finding that their lives have become decreasingly joyful and increasingly fearful
item.dc:creator: Bruce J. Klein (mailto:bjk@bjklein.com)

item.title: No Nuclear Energy from Iron
item.description: Fusion is a nuclear process that powers the stars it also provides electricity to homes and businesses while fission at times is used to induce fusion The products the elements produced during these nuclear processes proceed in the direction of a common element Iron
item.dc:creator: Nathan Cochran (mailto:Nebula@physicsforums.com)

item.title: Controlled Fusion with Nanotechnology Hydrogen Trap
item.description: This article discusses fusion and proposes an alternative way to control this potentially wonderful energy source How do we use the strengths of nanotechnology to our advantage and can we design a method to extract the energy more efficiently Rather than viewing the fuel as a tub of gasoline to ignite and burn into a giant solar blaze imagine it as carefully contained pulses like a fuelinjected engine Links included
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.title: ZeroG A common misinterpretation
item.description: Do you get confused when people talk about zeroG Ever wonder why spacecraft need to go so fast to stay in orbit The answers are all here
item.dc:creator: David K. Pullen (mailto:enigma555@mailcity.com)

item.title: Determining PressureDependent Equilibrium Constants
item.description: I finally figured out a way how to relate the equilibrium constant with that of pressure This article will show you how to do it without going through stacks of paper hey at least we are saving trees

item.title: The Idea that Shook Physics On The Consequences of Special Relativity
item.description: Ever wanted to find out more about SR This article will attempt to explain the time dilation the length contraction and the twin paradox but at least our twins aren39t those irritating Olsen twins
item.dc:creator: Philip Mathew (mailto:Feynman1983@hotmail.com)

item.title: What Exactly Is Curved
item.description: This compilation of thought experiments attempts to describe the most basic mathematics of spacetime curvature of General Relativity in a pictorial way The material is intended for readers familiar with special relativity but lost when trying to visualize Einstein39s theory on curved spacetime This work is a continuation of the paper Distortions of Relativistic Measure and gives a taste of the curvature in General Relativity
item.dc:creator: Erich Schoedl (mailto:erich_s@msn.com)

item.description: Existence is demonstrably paradoxical that is it does not make rational sense Nature may make perfectly rational sense but existence itself is clearly irrational and thus possibly supernatural

item.title: Distortion of Relativistic Measures
item.description: This article brings to light the variability of the observed length and rates of aging of relatively fast objects This angleofobservation dependent distortion is one of the most misunderstood consequences of Special Relativity Some basics about relativity including simple length contraction are initially covered to set up the topic with the help of two mischievous clocks and a smiley face

item.title: Implicit Differentiation
item.description: Implicit Differentiation is a technique used to differentiate a function when it cannot be explicitly solved for the dependant variable We will consider two methods for implicitly differentiating a function The first method is taught to students taking Calculus 1 however the second method requires knowledge of partial derivatives and is not always taught in Multivariable Calculus classes
